newsitem.title: USA: MIT's Dornbusch sees intervention at 130-135 yen.
newsitem.headline: MIT's Dornbusch sees intervention at 130-135 yen.

text.p: The 130 to 135 spot yen area could be a target zone for intervention, a Massachusetts Institute of Technology economist said Friday.

"A dollar rise and a rise in rates will test that question," Rudi Dornbusch, Ford International professor of economics and international management at MIT, said at the Futures Industry Association's annual conference here.

Dornbusch also said a 25-basis-point rise in short-term U.S. rates is "surely a foregone decision," and sees an inevitable rise in U.S. rates in the next three months. He said another 25-basis-point tightening could be occur before Christmas.
He expects volatility in currency markets, and said investors were heading for "a happy world for trading." ((Derivatives desk 312-408-8750;E-mail derivatives@reuters.com))
